body.p: Follow this procedure from a fresh xterm using tcsh shell before proceeding to labs.

Install the following PDK before using the LDK (this might have been completed by the LDK administrator). Refer to Intel P1278.3 (Intel 18A) PDK 0.9GA Process Design Kit User Guide for setup information:
This LDK training lab uses the opt12 tech option and the following layer stack:m14_2x_1xa_1xb_6ya_2yb_2yc__bm5_1ye_1yf_2ga_mim3x_1gb__bumpp

ol.li: Ensure that the INTEL_PDK and LAYERSTACK shell environment variables are set as outlined in the user guide for the PDK.

Change the directory to a lab workspace with at least 10 GB of available disk space.
Your administrator might specify a disk area that can be used.
Verify that this directory is empty and has directories for the first use: mkdir “<path to your LDK workspace>” setenv LDK_WORKAREA “<path to your LDK workspace>” cd $LDK_WORKAREA/
Set the environment pointer to the LDK source content as specified by the administrator:setenv INTEL_LDK “<path to tarball/extraction directory>”
Prepare the work area by sourcing the setup as shown below: source $INTEL_LDK/training/setup/intel/ldk_setup.csh

body.p: This step sets up the CAD tool environment variables and copies the LDK content into your workspace. As a lab user, you can now run the steps of the LDK labs as described in this document.
